greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Home primes in base 2: primes reached when you start with n and (working in base 2) concatenate its prime factors (A048985); repeat until a prime is reached (or -1 if no prime is ever reached). Answer is written in base 10.
comment: The first binary home prime that is not known is a(2295) - _Ely Golden_, Jan 09 2017
link: Ely Golden, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2294
Ely Golden, Mersenne Wiki Home Primes base 2
Ely Golden, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000 (a-file)
mathematica: f[n_] := Module[{fi}, If[PrimeQ[n], n, fi = FactorInteger[n]; Table[ First[#], {Last[#]}]& /@ fi // Flatten // IntegerDigits[#, 2]& // Flatten // FromDigits[#, 2]&]]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := TimeConstrained[FixedPoint[f, n], 1] /. $Aborted -> -1; Array[a, 55] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 01 2016 *)
results.author: Michael B Greenwald (mbgreen(AT)central.cis.upenn.edu)
